reviewText:
This otome visual novel feature a female protagonist Lilia who helps out at her grandmother's bakery shop. One day, she discovers she has turned into a luccretia as a half-human and half-cat creature. Amidst a backdrop of general dislike of luccretias by the local human population, this visual novel feature Lilia turning between a human and luccretia as Leea and her interactions with her childhood friend and eventual boyfriend Ronan, her grandmother, a frequent visitor at her grandmother's bakery Juli, Ronan's friend and superior Mars, an unnamed ELM member and a mysterious black cat over six chapters.

The game has plenty of save slots to allow different gameplay and dialogue choices to be made during the game, with a small popup icon of Lilia/Leea to reach a slightly different storyline branch or a love icon to reach a secret unlockable scene in each chapter, a chapter summary at the end of each chapter and the option to skip and fast-forward any part of the game.

The story and plot is written like a romantic comedy and has its share of humour and two nice happy endings.

The soundtracks and overall game presentation are great, it would have been nice if the theme song DLC contain any bonus soundtrack not in the game in addition to the theme song and lyric book. Recommended when at sale or in a bundle offer as both endings can be reached and the entire game's unlockable CG and music at gallery can be completed in less than 10 hours.

reviewText:
How to Take Off Your Mask is a visual novel game developed by the same people who made dUpLicity, Cafe 0, and the East Tower series.  This game has elements of fantasy, humor, and cuteness and without a doubt, I think this is the developer's best game ever.  ^^

HTTOYM tells the story of a girl named Lilia who works in her grandmother's bakery and has a childhood friend named Ronan.  She seemingly leads a normal life until one day, she turns into a luccretia, a half-human, half-cat being.  Suddenly, her life changes and well, I won't say anymore since that would clearly be spoiling the story.  ;)

So on to the review itself.  First off, I loved the story.  Although most of it is told from Lilia's point of view, there are times we can see it from Ronan's point of view.  It depends on how strong Lilia's relationship with Ronan is and whether she views things from a human's or luccretia's point of view.  There are indicators that can help determine what effects the choices you make have.  Although there are only two paths (basically whether Lilia takes on the human or luccretia point of view), I enjoyed playing both of them, especially the luccretia point of view.  I thought that the writing was excellent and even the grammatical errors were minor.

The art was great as well as the music so really, I can't think of a single complaint to make.  I loved Lilia's character and the relationship between her and Ronan and how it changed through the story.  Also, I liked the teaser that's unlocked after you complete both paths, as it gives promise to a sequel.  I would love for there to be a sequel to HTTOYM, as I found myself immersed in the story and would love to learn more, especially about who is behind wanting all of the luccretias exiled.

I'd recommend getting this game for anyone who is a fan of VNs although I'll admit that if you want one where the MC can date multiple guys, I'm sorry to disappoint but that isn't the case here.  Still, I think it's worth getting, especially if you want to enjoy a cute, light-hearted story.  ^^

reviewText: Finished human route, and I think it`s nice game to play if you like otome / VN`s with romance. Story is very adorable and cute, scenario focuses on the dilemmas and transformation which the protagonists undergo under the influence our decisions. You can say that game is simple because it has only two routes and one guy to romance, but it has a few nice twists and choices. I recommend this game and I look forward to the next from roseVeRte :)\n\nPS: I was a little disappointed that roseVeRte abandoned its previous graphic style - but I can imagine why.

reviewText:
Well, just got done playing the human side route. I must say, this game is very adorable! I highly recommend this game if you are a fan of visual novels.

Pros:
*Character sprites are VERY well done. The shading and proportions are excellent, and don't make me feel like I'm looking at a newgrounds flash game made by a 14 year old.
*Very well written story. Dialogue is well done, the chraracters, while not very in depth, I feel are quite decently written.
*Gameplay does not appear to have any bugs at all
*This game does appear to have some replay value
*This game is fully voiced, even the minor characters (all two of them). Voices are in Japanese.

Cons:
*This game is rather short (I am a huge speed reader, so actual gameplay was less than an hour for me. Then again, I can read a 600 page book in two hours). If you are a slower reader, I imagine this would take a bit longer.
*The story, while well written, could use a bit of fleshing out. I guess I just like more details and meat to a story.
*Price does feel a bit high to me. Then again, this is probably because of the voice acting.
*Plotline seems to skip around a bit, but given this is a light-hearted story, it doesn't really detract from anything.


All in all, if you love visual novels and reading, this is a good game. If you are a huge otome and VN fan like me, you won't mind the price. Otherwise, you may want to wait until this goes on sale.

reviewText: Who in the world is not wearing a mask? Some would say yes and thats only because the mask is so good, that they can even belie theirself. Only a few people in the world are not actors, can be themself. It need many courage to get it off, show the real character / thinking and hope to be accepted with the strenghts and weaknesses, but the most never can overjump their shadows and tell what they want. They have never the strength to be real free. So this game is about 5 persons that all hide secrets and take of their mask to trust one bye one. The story is not so good like the 2 games before from same developer, but its still a very good story with lovely characters and even if its feels they spin round by round on the same place a bit. So even if the suprising is missing this tale is interesting to get to the end and know what happen, what Juli and big brother plans, could they be the bad guys and help to trap her? Maybe, maybe not. So i am happy as i saw the 2 story parts, even if they are at the start the same (Bonus are different) and get at later chapters  a bit splitted and see the 2 endings and the secret discussion. I hope it get a 2nd part in future.\n\nSo for all VN Fans i can say, show trailer and get it with a discount and support this friendly low budget developer for more good ideas. I give this game personal 87 %. It could have a bit more parts, maybe about some history of people like Juli/ Grandmother/ Mars a bit, but its fine. So think about how muchthis work is for you worth for some hours and think how many months a developer need to work on a game. Thank you for reading. I hope you enjoy your purchase.

reviewText:
I really like roseVeRte‚Äôs games. And this one was one of the cutest visual novels I‚Äôve played on steam! Art style, BG, BGM, and VA were just perfect. Luccretia‚Äôs route was really cute, haha!
All the previous things which used to annoy me a bit on the other games from these developers are gone (more like technical stuff, I always liked their stories tho). This new story seems a bit cliche at first, but after playing both routes, I can definitely recommend this game. It‚Äôs cute, and I‚Äôm looking forward to see a How to Take Off Your Mask 2 soon. I also felt a deeper connection between the characters during Luccretia‚Äôs route.

8/10. There‚Äôs no ‚Äúsuper deep meaning‚Äù or ‚Äúsuper sad‚Äù stuff here, just a simple cute visual novel. If you enjoy this sort of game, get it on sale (I found it a bit short, and this game is kinda expensive to be honest)! I wish good luck to the developers on the second game, I‚Äôm really curious about what‚Äôs coming next.

reviewText:
Kawaii!

A girl finds herself a kitty girl, nyanya!
A boy becoming a city guard
Otome with single girl and single guy
And the growing pains they endure as they make choices on what they want to be to themselves and each other.

Went through both routes and enjoyed them. I'm a slow reader and do each storyline at a different time to re-experience it, rather than do it once and skip skip skip to just catch the differences right away. Either way there are still enought differences to give you good story. Choices can lead to a human ending and a kitty ending where the last few chapters have a bit of a different storyline to get to similar ending that is a cliff hanger.

They might have a sequel come out (certainly set up for it) as you get there feeling there's a lot of storyline around the two main characters that you only catch glimpses of.  Might have been fun to see more of that, especially Juli's character whom is my favorite.

The art is better than past games from them, IMO.

I can't figure out if there's stock music or new music, some of it seems familair to past games, it's nondescript so can't tell. Good background music, though not something I'd want the soundtrack for.

It was a nice fluffy distraction.

reviewText:
Honestly thought this was a butter churner vn, if you get my drift. Assumed I would get a vanilla romance that ended wet lol.

Instead I got a great story, with good artwork and audio.

The plot is split into 2 different routes: cat-girl side and human side, with your actions changing how the story progresses.

This story itself was good enough to not make me autoskip the second playthough, so I could see how the story differed, and I wasn't let down.

Although the price is a bit steep, this game is a gem, esp in bundled finds!

reviewText: How to Take Off Your Mask is a decent length visual novel (took me a little over 3.5 hours to complete, rest of my time is carding) with a nice, cute art style and a smooth soundtrack. With that said, in terms of gameplay, there is a bit lacking. There are only two routes to take, and I found that my choices did not have a significant impact in which route I took, but that might just be me. How to Take Off Your Mask makes up for this shortcoming with bonus scenes, which are, although short, a welcome addition. All in all, I did like the story a lot, but wish that there are options to romance other characters than the main one (no names cause, spoilers!). For those achievement hunters out there, such as myself, I found How to Take Off Your Mask a fairly easy 100%, even with 27 achievements. A price of 14.99 is a bit much to ask for for the game as it is now, so I would recommend waiting for a sale and paying around 9.99, give or take a dollar. To sum it up, How to Take Off Your Mask has great visuals, a good soundtrack, and a good story.\n8.5/10

reviewText:
I have found this game very enjoyable to play and read. I would be glad to suggest to anyone whom enjoys visual novels to invest in a copy of the game.

This visual novel is about a young lady name Lilia whom works in a bakery with her grandmother, and is visited by her childhood friend Ronan. One day, she discovers she has turned into a luccretia as a half-human and half-cat creature, she panics and her adventure into the world where being different causes hardships and sometimes even hatred, and the trials she faces as she tries to cope with the change she has experienced. Follow in her footsteps in the game as she faces these trials and also seeks friendship and love from her childhood friend and interacts with her other companions.

There are 2 main paths in the game, Human path where your choices are to regain your identity is towards your humanity, or to follow your instincts as a Luccretia and seek to belong as the entity you are a part human and feline person. If you complete both choices in a single session addition bonus content opens.

I personally rate it 5 stars.

I love revisiting my favorite stories time and again and this game has earned its place among that list. An extremely well thought out and fun visual novel. Please keep up the good work Bakufu Narayama/Chu-3 :)

I have also added a general guide to the achievements and other content available for this game. Feel free to look it up in the guides section for this game.

reviewText:
I've been wanting to play How to Take Off Your Mask since it was announced. The game tells the story of Lilia (can be changed), a girl who misteriously turns into a cat (luccretia) one day. She struggles to accept her new form while others in the city want the luccretias exiled or worse. Added to this is her childhood friend, Ronan, who might be keeping a secret  from her.

I found the story very cute, including Lilia's luccretia side. I feel like I can relate with the aspect of keeping a side of yourself secret from others. Ronan was absolutely adorable, but also manly and intriguing enough. He's one of my favorite type of characters in otome games. This game only has one romanceable character so if you're into romancing a bunch of guys, it might not be your type of game. For me, I'm okay with it because I always feel odd going for other guys in otome games. I usually have a favorite anyway, so some other guys might feel like a chore (it happened with Amnesia).  Anyway, the romance and story were very cute and lovely. It's a refreshing type of game. It's a bit on the short side though, I feel like it could be finished in one go. It took me a while because I spaced out my playing, plus I left the game idle for a long time today so that's why it says I've played so many hours. I have no problem with the length of the story, but I know others might so I just felt like pointing that out. The art is amazing though, I loved it. Also, the voice acting was high quality as well. This game has really good production value!

Some of the things that bothered me were related to the story itself. I felt like a couple of things were left unresolved and I'm not sure if this game will have a sequel, so I'm left wonderings about those things. I'm the kind of person who loves closure on her stories. These are the things that I felt were left unresolved:


Lilia's parents are still gone. I'm left wondering so many things. Are they still alive? If they are, why is it taking so long for them to come back. Are the luccretias not happy with the human kingdom either? Don't they want to have peace? Also, did they have other children while away? Does Lilia have siblings? I know it's random, but they've been gone for so long! I need answers. If they're not alive, what happened to them? I just really need answers.
Who was the bad guy? Throughout the game, Juli and Mars made it seem like it was someone they knew, someone powerful, but they never showed the bad guy. I was underwhelmed by this, as I was expecting a big reveal.
More on Laarz, the Luccretia kingdom. It was mentioned like twice in the game but we don't know much about it. At the end of the secret discussion, Juli decides he'll go there to investigate. I wish we could have seen that. Maybe even see everything be resolved fully.
Juli's royal family God power. We barely had a mention on it. He used it on Lilia in both routes, but we barely got an explanation of it. I wanted to know what he was capable of with those powers, since Mars made it seem as if it was dangerous.

I know the game is focused more on romance, but I feel that if you have these elements to a story, it's good to conclude everything clearly.

Other than that, this was a very lovely otome game and I recommend it to otome fans!

reviewText:
A charming Visual Novel about a magical world where humans and creatures called Luccretias, a mix between humans and cats, co-exist. As humans fear almost anything they can't control and have full comprehension about, most habitants of Leezera nurtures hate towards the Luccretias.

One day, Lillia, our protagonist, discovers that she's a Luccretia. How will her life be affected by that sudden discover? Will her relationship with Ronan, her beloved childhood friend, change? Will humans and Luccretias be able to co-exist pacifically in the future?

The game itself is pretty short and has two different patchs, who lead to two different endings. Sadly, the game focus too much into Lillia/Ronan relationship (they're a very cute couple indeed) and often forget the rest of the characters and the story itself. The developers left a lot of gaps in the story opened to be filled by a sequel, that I'll definitely play.

TL;DR: This game is a short but enjoyable experience and it needs a sequel.

reviewText: The plot is VERY cliche, and even though the anthropomorphic cats are pretty creative, the way the characters fall in love is not, and I find that the MC can't tell that the boy loves her despite how obvious it is, to be annoying and just there because that's how it always is. I'm not sure this game is worth the $14.99. The originality in the demo was lost to the banality of the following chapters in the story. If you haven't been exposed to much romantic themed stories, you may think this story is original, which is fine, then this game is for you. But if you're looking for an otome game that breaks the mold, this isn't the game for you.

Just finished it and quite enjoyed my time. Will even go back to try out all the other routes~ Probably not a thing for everyone, but was rigth up my alley. I do like anime. I also do like cuteness so I quite appreciated that the game gave me a few choices there hehe~

reviewText:
A very pleasant, pretty game, just as expected of roseVeRte. The story is really nice and enjoyable, although overall plot feels unfinished... I suppose that's because a sequel is planned? But as a story of the heroine and Ronan, it definitely feels satisfying.
Art is very good, although i must admit, i do miss the usual art style. Music is pleasant and i'm absolutely in love with the theme song!
At first i wasn't very sure what to think about characters, but i've grown to like them. Everyone is likeable and well written. My faves are Juli and Mars though, i hope we will see more of them, haha.
In overall, How to Take Off Your Mask is a solid, good game, and i definitely recommend it.
